name: NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky

reviews.text: Great location, breakfeast and service, but whilst the room we were given was quiet, facing the courtyard with a pleasant view, the room was quite small and had a serious style deficit. Very 80's and well below expectations given the room rate. It's time to upgrade....
reviews.title: Great location and service but little style and far from Grand
excellant!
reviews.text: i took my boyfirend to amsterdam for the first time and stayed at this hotel about two years ago..and i remember every single bit of it! it is a beautiful hotel and we were greeted immediately by two bell boys...very grand indeed..the rooms are spacious and of high quality what you'd expect from a four star hotel...a really memorable first time to dam..and it's location is just fantastic in the midst of everything..we had no problem getting around as it's centrally located..if you go to dam you must stay in this hotel ..highly recommended. happy smoking!

reviews.title: Great location shame about late night noise outside
reviews.text: Overall excellent hotel but avoid Square facing rooms at weekends unless you stay up to 3 am. Street noise through poorly insulated window frames is obtrusive.Due entirely to the fact that this hotel is unfortunately on walking route to and from red light district.Great hotel but ask for inner facing room unless you party late.

Visited Amsterdam with some friends and stayed at this great hotel. We had rooms overlooking Dam Square, where there was lots of activity well into the early hours, but it didn't disturb our beauty sleep.( at least I don't think it did.) We did not eat at the hotel as it was expensive. The location is excellent as you are central to everthing Amsterdam has to offer.
reviews.title: Weed had a fantastic time !!

reviews.text: As my friend and her partner are quite partial to a ruby murray they found a nice Indian resteraunt and then had to agree with "Robbie Williams" that Amsterdam is the best place for a good curry. The Coffee shops are excellent we had the best coffee ever !!!. Visited Anna Frank museum for the second time and it was still amazing.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a pre-crusie night and could not have been happier with the result. We arrived in the morning and were able to get into our room right away to take a nap before hitting the streets later in the day. The hotel's management went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable by providing some extras during our one-night stay. The hotel's location is perfect for exploring Amsterdam and for easy access to the train station and the cruise terminal. We stayed in the newer Amsterdam Wing which was extremely quiet, even for sleeping during the day. We were very please with the hotel and would stay there again.
reviews.title: They Made Us Feel Welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening so had no issues regarding check in. Anybody arriving at the hotel during the morning should expect a queue and a lengthy wait for check in and check out. We were greeted by a professional and friendly staff who advised us that our room was automatically upgraded. Our room was new, clean and modern. The bed was huge and comfortable. Only con to the room was the scenery outside the window but I wasent really bothered by it. Did not here any noise from outside, so had a very comfortable experience.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: One warning to anyone booking this hotel. I was not aware before i arrived at the hotel that there was a charge of 150 euros as a deposit for using any additional services of the hotel e,g minibar. The hotel also prefer that they charge this amount on your credit card. I was refunded the money when i had checked out minus the city tax. However, i do not blame the hotel for this but for the operator that i had booked my travel with.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Overall, a great hotel in a great location. Would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Beautiful location, good services

reviews.text: Due to the location, the room is a little noisy. in the middle of the night we could clearly hear people screaming and yelling. Otherwise the location is perfect. The breakfast is very good selection.
reviews.title: Great experience
What a Perfect Hotel!
reviews.text: What a place....from the moment we entered the lobby, every single employee that we encountered on our 5-night stay made a point to greet us. They were quite friendly and accommodating. We were upgraded to rooms in the Royal Wing, which faced the south side. The rooms lacked for nothing. I do imagine, though, that some rooms at this hotel could be a bit noisy depending on the time of year and if people are out on the streets and in The Dam to late hours. We celebrated my parents anniversary while there; and the hotel staff didn't miss a beat with remembering it with handwritten notes and chocolates in their room along with champagne and a beautiful cake at our breakfast in the Winter Garden restaurant. Location is perfect and very convenient to Centraal Station (10 minute walk). The trams stop directly in front of the hotel. Restaurant prices in the hotel can be pricy....but there are plenty of eateries nearby. We'd stay here again....definitely.

reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent staff
reviews.text: After having seen and admired this hotel for over 30 years, we finally stayed here. It's not a modern cold hotel, but a classy place with a sense of history. We got a great price on the Internet (about $170 in July, 2004). We didn't have breakfast included, it didn't look that great and was very expensive. There are lots of places to get something to eat nearby. While the roooms could be more luxurious, and may have seen better days, it is still a great hotel, and the service was outstanding. They let us check in early, the conceige had great suggestions, and the location was perfect.

reviews.title: wonderful
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed there for 5 nights for the New Year... and loved every second of it. The room was really big and clean and the service was irreproachable. We got a really good deal for the room via a web site and all in all we were both enchanted by every aspect of our stay.

reviews.title: Overpriced faux luxury
reviews.text: We recently returned from a trip to Amsterdam and Germany, traveling with a family of five. We stayed at this hotel on our last night as we had a flight out of Amsterdam and it's convenient to the train station. We had 2 rooms in the Royal wing, which were OK, but definitely not worth the money we paid compared to other hotels on our trip in the same price range. Hotel Krasnapolsky seems to cut corners to give guests the appearance of luxury without actually having to pay for it. The rooms are attractive, with hardwood floors and modern furnishings. But they skimp on the big ticket items. Other hotels in this price range have very fine linens and down comforters. This one had heavier synthetic comforters and less expensive bedding. There are robes and slippers and abundant little goodies in the bathroom, but the flourescent lighting in the bathroom was dim and depressing. The decor was bargain-basement trying to look expensive -- faux granite on the bathroom floor and no evidence of design or artfulness anyplace in the hotel. I knew it was an old hotel and expected to find at least a hint of its former elegance. I didn't. I'm glad we didn't pay the 21 euros apiece for breakfast in the Winter Garden. (there's a very nice cafe next door with a huge breakfast for less than half that.) I suppose what you are paying for is the Hotel's Dam Square location, but considering how easy it is to get around in Amsterdam, and considering how noisy and dirty the Dam is, why not stay some place a little further away and just walk over? As to convenience to the train station, it's about a 3-4 block walk which is fine for someone who isn't traveling with kids but we ended up taking a taxi to the airport anyway!

reviews.title: Watch our for those rooms....
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stop at this hotel so here's my thoughts.

reviews.title: Great location, great bed!
reviews.text: I have to say that if you do not get a room upgrade, your thoughts on this hotel will be very different.
i went to this hotel for a chill time in the afternoon on their terrace and i had it.. even a bit to chill...
reviews.title: great terasse

reviews.text: The terrace is amassing, green zone in the center of the city. The staff on service are great, (they are consultants, not hotel staff).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Excellent Location

reviews.text: The hotel kitchen had big timing problems.. i waited about 40 minutes for a dish, and few of our orders were simply forgotten.
reviews.title: Perfectly nice, but far from 5 star.

reviews.text: The place is really nice, it would deserve some permenant staff witch are correctly payed so they take care of their customers.
reviews.title: Guest of the Day

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Krasnapolsky and it was even better than I remembered. The hotel has been refurbished since my last stay and the room was beautifully decorated, clean and extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay in the Centre of Amsterdam

reviews.text: We wanted to end our 2-week trip to Europe with a 5-star hotel for our family of 4. Unfortunately, this hotel is right in the middle of "party-central" of Amsterdam. Our taxi made its way through gobs of people as if we were fleeing the city in a movie. When we arrived, we were promised "best available" rooms, but our view was of the garbage pails and a roof. We had to call housekeeping because we found pubic hairs all over our sheets that were obviously not cleaned. The kids had a little better room facing the Dam square, but complained it was noisy all night until around 3 a.m. If dirty linen and noisy locations is your thing, then this hotel is for you.
reviews.title: Do not recommend

reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend recently stayed in this hotel (Aug 2005) and we adored it! It is in a prefect location.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel and Location!

reviews.text: It is in the middle of Dam Square, which is the heart of Amsterdam. You could not be in a better location.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!

reviews.text: The hotel is in perfect walking distance to all the main sights. We walked to the Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum, and the Heineken Brewery.
reviews.title: A faux pas

reviews.text: It is right beside the two main shopping streets and department stores, and is surrounding by great restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Great Hotel - Room ok
reviews.text: This hotel is close to the train station (walkable with light luggage) & also to the most touristy areas & red light district. It was incredibly chaotic and if I were to stay again I would likely choose a hotel a bit further out. That being said the hotel itself is centrally located so you can walk anywhere. It is an absolutely gorgeous hotel - the room was clean - the bathroom was gigantic - the food in the restaurant was likely the best I had during our stay (again it's a very touristy area everything is over priced and we found the quality lacking). This was our largest room during our European tour and it was also the room with the least character. It was cheap at $120E so it was near the rear of the hotel looking onto another building (not much light). Overall I give it a great rating even though we likely stayed in one of their least desirable rooms because it had everything but character...and character likely costs more than $120E a night for a central - upscale - well kept - hotel in Amsterdam.

reviews.title: A really enjoyable stay
reviews.text: A great place to stay, Staff is frendly and attentive. Its central to almost everything. The bed and pillows where fantastic. The High Noon Tea in the lobby is resonable and the food is great, as well as the view of Dam Square. Be careful making phone calls especially to cell phones its very pricey

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.text: This place was fantastic! Helpful and courteous staff. The room was fabulous! The breakfast buffet was to die for! Fantastic location, right in the middle of dam square. Everything is in walking distance from this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Fantastic.
reviews.text: Fantastic. What a great hotel situated right in heart of everything. The staff were so incredibly nice and could not do enough to make you comfortable.The room was wonderful and very very clean. If you have a problem with this you are either way too fussy or the type who would not be pleased with anything ie a saddo.
Ideally located in Dam Square though a little too close to the red-light area if you want to avoid that sort of thing.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: A great price for a quality hotel in a superb location offering fantastic facilities. Rooms were clean and well equipped with the only thing lacking is the friendliness of the staff on check in. A smile goes a long way!!
reviews.title: Fantastic value for money

reviews.text: I booked this through Hotwire. They claim that it was a 5 star hotel - based on all other travel sites. I read some of the other reviews after booking and thought that people may be exaggerating when they gave their negative reviews. Unfortunately, they are spot on. This 5 star property is really a 2 - 3 star hotel. I have stayed at better airport hotels - the ones that you only need to show up for the night and leave early the next morning.
reviews.title: Two star hotel posing as a 5 star

reviews.text: Everything about it is shabby. From the cheap Ikea-like furnishings to the old, dirty carpets in the halls. There is very little closet space and so we had all our luggage strewn over the room (no drawers, credenza, etc.). The bathroom had a translucent glass wall and if you turned on the light in the bathroom the whole room was flooded with light. This made it a problem with my family when I had to get ready early mornings to get to my meetings. By the way, this is their newly remodeled rooms.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are several reviewers that say that it is a prime location. Yes, it is in the center of the city but I would hardly call it perfect - there are noisy crowds that congregate in the square and leave all their trash behind. The Red Light district is right behind the hotel and there is a constant flow of traffic of on-lookers, shoppers and users of the services there, all contributing to the noise level and the "sleaziness" of the hotel location.
reviews.title: Spring Break

reviews.text: I did not see any redeeming value of this hotel. I would direct you to choose some other hotel - if not then you will be writing a similar review as this one.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but not what I would say 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A sprawling hotel, we were met in the lobby by Public Enemy. If it's good enough for Chuck D and Flavor Flav, then it's good enough for us! And sure enough it was. Friendly, helpful staff, fabulous location and a breakfast buffet that's not to be missed. We will be back.
reviews.title: City break with a luxury feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't think I could have chosen a better hotel to stay in for our short break in Amsterdam. From the moment we arrived the service was wonderful - very friendly and welcoming staff, from front of house and concierge, to room service and breakfast staff. There was nothing that was too much trouble and they made us feel extra special as we were celebrating a birthday.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, great location - made a great holiday!

reviews.text: Our room was lovely and spacious, I loved the hotel robes and slippers too! Lots of little toiletries were in the bathroom and a minibar was available as well. The aircon broke down when we were there, but we reported it to the desk on the way out one evening and it was fixed by the time we'd returned - couldn't ask for more really. My partner found the aircon a little noisy at night, but it didn't bother me and I found it got too warm without it on during our stay.
reviews.title: A wonderful long weekend
Great hotel in a great area
reviews.text: The bar was in the Summer Room while we were there and was really cosy and informal, ideal for evening drinks and good company.

The Winter Garden where breakfast is served is a stunning area, and the breakfast has to be the best selection I have ever seen. There must surely be every taste catered for, an absolute array of delicious foods and drinks is on offer, with a chef making omelettes to order as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from a short break at the Krasnapolsky. We had noticed the hotel on a previous visit to Amsterdam and liked its location. We were not disappointed. Our room faced the back of the hotel and whilst not large, was quiet, spotlessly clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Staff in the hotel were courteous and extremely attentive. We ate lunch and dinner and both were excellent. The hotel was very well kept, spacious and airy. We can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Go!

reviews.text: We had a very pleasant 2-night stay at the Kras. Situated on Dam Square opposite the Palace, it was a prime location. Bus and tram stops are right across the street, so it was easy to get anywhere. The hotel itself was inviting from the lobby onward. We arrived early in the day, yet a room was ready for us. It was clean and well appointed. The business center was handy, and the front desk staff was pleasant and eager to serve. We would stay again if the occasion arose.
reviews.title: Delightful Hotel!

reviews.text: I was disappointed with the room, which was ok in size, had a big balcony, good bathroom and comfy bed, but no better than average. Not five star. The hotel was really rather ordinary. It was not at all 'Grand' and in places scruffy. Although the central location and extravagant breakfast (champagne!) redeemed the experience, the service was not great, (no ice bucket as requested, long wait at check in, wrong information, confusion over bill etc etc). Look around before you choose your hotel.
reviews.title: Breakfast Great.. Room ok..?

reviews.text: Perfectly located on Dam Square, this certainly maintains the ambience of a traditional European 'Grand' Hotel, with comfortable public areas and decent service. My bedroom, although not the most modern in the world and suffering from noise outside late at night, was large and comfortable. Very pleasant, but more four-star than five.
reviews.title: Great location, decent hotel

reviews.text: Don't be duped into renting one of these "luxury apartments". I rented a two bedroom deluxe for a week and it was filthy and disgusting. I checked out the following morning. Words can not describe this experience other than to say that I felt like I was in a ghetto. The hallway entrance should have been my first clue as the carpet is torn and filthy, the walls are filthy and it just gets worse from there. I will say that the night manager that I spoke to was very professional and polite vs the girls at the front desk who giggled and laughed when I lodged my complaint. I am very puzzled by some of the other reviews regarding these apartments and their glowing comments. I cannot believe that the hotel is even associated with these "luxury apartments"; it is false advertising to describe these as "luxury apartments". I will never stay at the Krasnapolsky again!!!
reviews.title: Horrific Apartment/Tenement squalor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pictures in this hotel on travel were not alluring, but when I arrived at this hotel, I was impressed with the staff and location. At time of arrival, I was greeted and serviced well with the front desk staff. I was upgraded to the apartment rooms which was located at the back of this hotel. The room was big and spacious, and had a balcony overlooking the city. Internet was slow,but worked. The only thing I did not like on the room, was when you showered, the water would splattter on the floor, otherwise bathrooms were clean. There were few minor cosmetic flaws on the ceiling and balcony, but were tolerable. You also have the option to get breakfast buffet, but you can also opt out on it. Overall, clean, friendly staff and superb location. We were always out, so it is a great hotel for active travellers.
reviews.title: LVTraveller/ Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beginning April we (my wife and me) stayed for three days in this hotel in Amsterdam. In this hotel they have old style (not renovated rooms) and they have modern style (renovated rooms). We make a choice of a modern room, which feels comfortable. It’s was cold outside and the air co/heating doesn’t give us enough temperature. We called the reception and nearly immediately came a technician to see the problem and half hour later we had a ‘good temperature’. We also asked extra pillows at the reception, which they bring directly to our room. We asked also other things and received a correct answer to all our demands. We booked this staying including the breakfast.
reviews.title: Stylish historical 5* hotel in the centre of Amsterdam

reviews.text: The champagne-breakfast (classical in 5* hotels) happened in the so called ‘wintergarden’.
reviews.title: Not bad overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The champagne (cava) wasn’t the best, although for the rest of the breakfast was everything ok.
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ‘wintergarden’ by him is a beautiful historical place and we liked very much this style.
reviews.title: Not a five stars hotel

reviews.text: We chose the hotel after reading the tripadvisor reviews. It was even better when we booked the room due to the special offer theyhad on the time. It was only £250 for a week for a double room for the both of us! The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the station and is overlooking Dam Square, which is a perfect location. We were met by a very helpful doorman who took our cases and showed us reception. The staff were very friendly and off we went to our room. The room was huge and gorgeous and the bed was the biggest we have ever stayed in! There were fresh linen, towels and a basket of toiletries every morning. The dining rooms in the hotel are fantastic and definately worth a visit, even if you are not staying there!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, Fantastic location,
Superb Romantic Break
reviews.text: And make sure on the way in you grab a few sweets from the reception, they have bowls of them everywhere. It was all the small thoughtful touches that made this hotel special and we will be going back.

We stayed 28 Aug - 1 Sept as a romatic break for two. The hotel was immaculate. The room was clean and a decent size for Amsterdam. The hotel's facilities were fantastic and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was a little expensive so we ate out most of the time, but we would highly recommend the American breakfast via room service as it was ample for 2 people; and priced at 23euro, it was the same cost as eating out for two anyway. We would strongly recommend this hotel as it is so central to everthing and having viewed a number of other hotels in the area, this one was by far the best. Try to get a special deal though. We paid 520euro for double room (back of hotel as its quieter) via bookings.com for 4 nights and that was a fabulous rate considering the real rate was well over 1000euro. Cannot fault this hotel.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: went there during the most dirtiest week of amsterdam, they had a sanitation strike. the hotel was great, housekeeping did a wonderful job. but the reception was a bit unfriendly. the porter was a great help. do not eat at that japanesse restaurant inside the hotel. it sucks! it tasted burn and lot of salt. . over all its a cool place to visit. but not much to see. went to ann franks museum, thats what i like the most. dont waste ur money on that palace, museum, rather walk around town, and shop. i was a bit scared. but it was ok.
reviews.title: Good choice for a romantic weekend

reviews.text: I have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam where I took my boyfriend as a birthday treat. As it was both our first time in this city, I originally wanted to stay at a canal house (more typical) but I found out that most of them had a 2 or even 3 night policy.
reviews.title: Excellent if you get a good rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our sixth visit to the Krasnapolsky over the last ten years. It is an ideal hotel for a short break and has reasonably sized, clean rooms with very comfortable beds. Make sure you have lots of time in the morning because you will want to linger over breakfast which is a lavish affair offering almost anything you can think of including champagne. The hotel is situated very centrally on Dam Square with easy access to everywhere either on foot or by the efficient tram system.
reviews.title: Good hotel in central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, with friendly staff and good service. When we arrived we got a free upgrade to one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was modern and clean, and had a cool and relaxing atmosphere. The bed was a bit hard, but the pillows were great! We checked out on a sunday, and really appreciated the "lazy sunday" offer, didnt have to check out until 5 pm, free of charge. Robes and slippers provided in the room, really comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The location coludnt be better for a short stay in Amsterdam, "everything" is in walking distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Not sure about 5 stars

reviews.text: I booked an apartment as I was staying longer than a few days and did not want to eat at a restaurant the whole time. The check in process went smoothly, not long to wait. A concierge led me to my room as it was an easier option than having the reception staff try to give directions. I had to leave the front door, walk around a couple of corners and down the street to an outside entrance along a canal. My apartment was on the top floor, which meant carrying my luggage up several flights of narrow, curved stairs. This was in a different, older building I believe as it looked quite different from the newer-looking lobby. The building looked ok, apart from the ceiling and wall across from my apartment door, which had a large water leak stain with mold growing in the ceiling. It had obviously been there some time and as of the last night I was there - when it rained quite a bit - was still leaking. Not something one expects to see in a 5* property. The apartment was fantastic. It looked great, the furniture was comfortable and the kitchen area was useful. It overlooked the back alley where garbage/recycling was put, as well as a courtyard area. There were two days when the smoke alarm went off for no reason I could detect. At night it was mostly quiet but being woken up in the morning by workers in the alley was not the best alarm. I did not need much help from the staff but when I did they were very helpful and friendly. I found it very cold the first couple of nights I was there until I finally called the reception to ask with help turning the a/c off. The location is great, within easy walking distance of anything you might want to see in Amsterdam. Instead of charging my room at the time of booking or check in, it was charged at check out, which I do not prefer. Also, extra taxes were added on at the time. This is no problem but I would prefer to know about them and the amounts before I agree to book the room. All in all, it was a wonderful trip. I would return to stay at the hotel but probably take a room instead of an apartment.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, a bit expensive

reviews.text: Great hotel, wonderful location. Access to trams and a wonderful breakfast. Beautifully designed, old but well refurbished. Comfortable rooms. Very well recommended!!!
reviews.title: Happy new year

reviews.text: Staff, service, cleanliness, and equipment in room were excellent. Room was too warm and furnishings were shabby. Hotel has not been refurbished in a long time - it looked tired. Drinks in the lobby were wonderful.
reviews.title: Hotel was "tired".
Free ballon' in Amsterdam
reviews.text: I can't even list all the bad things about my 6 day stay here. One instance was that I brought with only 2 pair of quick drying man-undies. The first morning when I needed to use hair dryer to help dry my only clean pair, the device quit after 2 seconds. Had to go commando to a work meeting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the staff is friendly, though completely unhelpful.
reviews.title: The Grand Hotel

reviews.text: Only reason to stay here is its extremely close location to the Red Light District, so if proximity to prostitutes is a plus, have at it.
reviews.title: Return Visit So Much Better

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel a few times now. Stunning, clean, grand hotel. Front of hotel overlooks Dam Square and the Royal Palce. There is also a back route on to the Red Light District (The quieter end of the RLD)
reviews.title: Very good for business travels

reviews.text: i choose this hotel for location .i stayed middle floor between graund floor and 1st floor and when the female walk on teh corridor ,you can hear their walks in your room very well.Also some room us renovated and some not .if you booked cheap rate than they directly fix for you standar room and on your check in as you to upgrate your room with higher price
reviews.title: Centrally Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky have ancient look from the outside but it has touch of modern age inside. It may look unattractive from the outside which may largely be due to the prevailing culture in Europe and the surrounding buildings, notwithstanding, it is beautiful right from the reception to the dining/restaurant arena. Although the staff are always in a hurry thereby ingoring the most valueable ethics of hospitality business which is about personal service to the customers. The hotel needs to improve on showing courtesy to the customers particularly the front desk officers. Nonetheless, the breakfast setting is very commendable with the provision for varieties of food. Although we actually paid for a room but ended up in an apartment at the back of the main building which looked like a basement to us. This actually deprived us of enjoying a view of surrounding buildings from our room.
reviews.title: Fusion of Old with Moderninty

reviews.text: I agree with the reviews in here. This hotel may have been 5 star 10-20 yrs ago but now it is very dated and shabby. Rooms are clean enough but dated. Service is mediocre and the staff are not very attentive or dressed well. Price is poor despite the location. There are better hotels nearby that are better value (convent for example). Even the free wi-if is stingy (100mb and you pay over that)? Fine for browsing but me and my partner were working so this was eaten quickly. Most other hotels in Amsterdam don't have limits (and all offer free wi-if, I've stayed in a lot if places). Breakfast also isn't included in the std price which is poor. Fine as a one off but wouldn't come back.
reviews.title: Not 5 Star - not recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Krasnapolsky - Our Weekend Break Retreat
reviews.title: Krasnapolsky - Our Weekend Break Retreat

reviews.text: Stayed at the Krasnapolsky many times over the years, heading back at the end of November
reviews.title: Excellent location
Excellent food!
reviews.text: Excellent location for a start, on Dam Square and on the edge of the main shopping area and the red light district. Also within walking distance of Centraal station. At first was disappointed with the size and decor of the bedroom but became used to it and quite liked it in the end! The staff were really friendly and the food was unbelievable. We ate in the French restaurant and had brunch in the gorgeous Winter Garden and it was fantastic. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Unbeatable
reviews.text: The Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky exceeded all my expectations. From the minute we checked in until we left 4 days later it was heaven. The buffet breakfast is in a league of it's own and the beautiful Winter Garden setting just adds to the ambiance of this the most important meal of the day. The quality of the sevice in the lobby bar, the bar and the restaurant can not be faulted.All staff made us feel most welcome. If you have time pay the inhouse Japenese restaurant a visit, you will not be disappointed,all food is cooked on a hotplate at your table.A culinary delight!! The room we stayed in was superb.I feel the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky made our trip to Amsterdam perfect.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: great hotel great service got a good deal on hotels.nl. this hotel right in the middle of dam square great location we had room looking over dam square. the beds are huge and so comfortable. easy walking distance to everywhere. would def recommend

reviews.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Amsterdam
reviews.text: This hotel is certainly an institution in Amsterdam. It is very nice inside, but the staff is sometimes a little rude and posh and rooms look pretty old. It is a good choice though. The place where you have breakfast is gourgeous. Very close to everything.

reviews.title: Decent business hotel...Barbizon Palace is better!
reviews.text: This is one of those places you come if you want to get re-Americanized prior to coming back home. Here you find a large lobby with bar and piano player, a helpful concierge desk, hundreds of rooms rather than handfulls, 24-hour roomservice and if you can believe this; they have an ice machine!!!

description: The NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky hotel in Amsterdam is located in the very heart of the city, right on the central Dam square near many major tourist and business attractions. Situated in a historical building that dates back to 1865, the hotel combines a traditional feel with the comfort and style of modern conveniences. Numerous Amsterdam tourist attractions are within easy walking distance of the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky, including the Royal Palace, Nieuwe Kerk, Anne Frank House, Van Gogh museum, red-light district, and Heineken Brewery. The NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky is also quite convenient for business travelers, with public transportation readily available to access places like the RAI Convention Center, Schiphol Airport, and World Trade Center.The NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky offers a total of 468 stylish guest rooms, including one split-level suite, six luxurious junior suites, and 35 fully equipped apartments. Stop by the fitness center for a workout or relax with a soothing massage after your busy day. If you arrive by car, the hotel has a parking attendant at your service and a secure paid garage. Excellent public transportation connections take you all around Amsterdam, with bus and tram stops right outside the hotel. The central train station is only five minutes away and Schiphol Amsterdam Airport is just a 25 minute taxi or car ride.There is no shortage of fine food and drink at the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. Enjoy the hotel’s exquisite buffet breakfast, served every morning in the Summer Garden and glass-roofed Winter Garden. The hotel restaurant Reflet offers an à la carte dinner selection and menu of belle époque French style cuisine. Grand Café Mathilde offers a great selection of homemade tea, liqueurs, and an exceptional view of the Dam plaza. The hotel is also home to the Wynand Fockink Distillery, which dates back to 1679, where you can taste and buy top gins and liqueurs, and its Golden Palm Bar offers a wide variety of the refreshing cocktails.The NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky is considered the largest conference hotels in the Netherlands and Belgium, offering an impressive assortment of facilities to help make sure your events are successful. Conference facilities include 22 fully equipped and air-conditioned function rooms, which can accommodate groups of any size up to 1600 people.
